meaningMnemonic: This is the noun version of the kanji <kanji>circumference</kanji>, so it means <vocabulary>circumference</vocabulary> too.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You really want to measure the <vocabulary>circumference</vocabulary> of something but there doesn't seem to be anything round around. That's when you remember, "<reading>Mah Wa</reading>lnuts! (まわ)." The walnuts in your pocket have an easy <vocabulary>edge</vocabulary> to measure.
